snippet: While the Israeli military used to plan for conventional armored battle, its forces now train to withstand fighters who have antitank missiles and underground hide-outs.
abstract: Israeli military officials worry that militant Lebanese organization Hezbollah is gaining significant battlefield experience as it helps to shore up the government of Pres Bashar al-Assad in its struggle against Syrian rebel forces; although Syrian conflict has kept organization occupied, many fear only way Assad can repay Hezbollah is by providing it with sophisticated weapons.
lead_paragraph: While the Israeli military used to plan for conventional armored battle, its forces now train to withstand fighters who have antitank missiles and underground hide-outs.

headline.main: Israel Watches Warily as Hezbollah Gains Battle Skills in Syria
headline.print_headline: Israel Watches Warily as Hezbollah Gains Battle Skills in Syria

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
